page.syntax: Filter_Expression as C = top_records(count as n[,filter as c])

argument.name: Filter_Expression
argument.description: An expression that selects records from a table. Numeric

argument.name: filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = ".T." (All records). A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value and selects records from the table.

page.description: Return the top 'count' records for a given sort order.
page.discussion: A special function used only in queries to return the top Quantity of records in a table for a given sort order. If the optional filter is supplied, only the records selected by the filter are returned. Note : The term "top" does not imply that record values are examined. "Top" means first, given the current sort order.

section.title: Example
section.description: See Top, Bottom, Nth Record and Random Record Queries for more information. The following query returns the top 10 orders placed after May 1, 2000.
section.example: dim tbl as P dim inx as P tbl = table.current() query.filter = "top_records(10, \"orderdate > {5/1/2000}\")" query.order = "order_total" inx = tbl.query_create() topparent.resynch()
